Article Title: American ski racer Lindsey Vonn seeks strength from late coach after knee injury crash clouds Milan Cortina Olympics future
Article Text:
American ski racer Lindsey Vonn seeks strength from late coach after knee injury crash clouds Milan Cortina Olympics future (Image via Getty)

Lindsey Vonn reflects on Erich Sailer as knee injury clouds Milan Cortina Olympic plans

Lindsey Vonn is hurting, unsure, and waiting for medical answers just days before the Winter Games. On Friday, Jan. 30, she crashed during a World Cup downhill race in Crans-Montana and injured her left knee. The fall came in poor visibility, and the race was later stopped for safety. Vonn was taken by helicopter to a local hospital. Since then, she has not said if she will race at the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics.As she waits, Vonn turned to someone who shaped her life in the sport. On Monday, Feb. 2, she visited the grave of her late coach, Erich Sailer, and shared the moment online. Her message was short, honest, and full of feeling. ‚ÄúI know exactly what he would say‚Ä¶ Just wish he was here to say it,‚Äù Lindsey Vonn wrote on her Instagram Stories, posting a photo of Sailer‚Äôs gravesite. The timing says everything, the Olympics are close, her knee is hurt and her future for this month is still unknown. In that space between hope and doubt, Vonn chose to remember the person who always guided her.Sailer was not just another coach in Vonn‚Äôs life. He was there from the very start.According to The Athletic, he coached Vonn‚Äôs father, Alan Kildow, and was even at the hospital on the day Vonn was born. When she was seven years old, Sailer began coaching her too. Their bond lasted decades. Sailer died in August 2025 at the age of 99.Vonn‚Äôs injury happened fast and hard. After losing control during the downhill run, she slammed into the safety nets and grabbed her left knee. Medical staff rushed to help her on the slope. Later that day, she explained the situation herself.‚ÄúI crashed today in the Downhill race in Switzerland and injured my left knee,‚Äù Vonn wrote in a statement shared on Instagram. ‚ÄúI am discussing the situation with my doctors and team and will continue to undergo further exams.‚ÄùShe did not hide how heavy the moment feels. ‚ÄúThis is a very difficult outcome one week before the Olympics‚Ä¶ but if there‚Äôs one thing I know how to do, it‚Äôs a comeback. My Olympic dream is not over,‚Äù she wrote. ‚ÄúThank you for all of the love and support. I will give more information when I have it. Thank you to all the medical staff who helped me today. I am grateful for all the incredible help I received.‚ÄùThe next day, Vonn skipped the Super-G race and cheered for her teammates instead. ‚ÄúThank you for all of the love and support I have received,‚Äù she posted. ‚ÄúMeans the world to me. Doing my best right now‚Ä¶. üôèüèªü§ûüèª.‚ÄùAt 41, Lindsey Vonn is trying to return to the Olympics after years away and many injuries. If she does race, she could become the oldest woman to compete in Olympic alpine skiing. For now, nothing is decided. What is clear is this: when things feel uncertain, Vonn goes back to her roots, to the coach who taught her how to believe.
Article Summary: American ski racer lindsey vonn seeks strength from late coach after knee injury crash clouds milan cortina olympics future. On monday, feb. 2, she visited the grave of her late coach, erich sailer, and shared the moment online. ‚Äúi know exactly what he would say‚Ä¶ just wish he was here to say it,‚Äù she wrote.

Article Title: Rafael Nadal‚Äôs father calls Carlos Alcaraz lucky after Australian Open win and questions the strength of his opponents
Article Text:
Rafael Nadal‚Äôs father calls Carlos Alcaraz lucky after Australian Open win and questions the strength of his opponents (Image via Getty)

Toni Nadal explains his view on Carlos Alcaraz, Novak Djokovic, and the modern rivalry

Carlos Alcaraz stood at the center of Rod Laver Arena on Sunday night with history in his hands. At just 22 years old, the Spaniard won the Australian Open and completed his Career Grand Slam. But even as the crowd celebrated, a different conversation started back in Spain. Rafael Nadal ‚Äôs father, Toni Nadal, said Alcaraz was ‚Äúlucky‚Äù because the players he faced were not as strong as the ones from his own era.Carlos Alcaraz earned the title the hard way on paper. He lost the first set, then came back to beat Novak Djokovic 2-6, 6-2, 6-3, 7-5 in the final. The win stopped Djokovic from lifting his 11th Australian Open trophy. It also marked the first time Novak Djokovic lost an Australian Open final. That alone made the night historic. But Toni Nadal‚Äôs comments shifted the focus. While praising Alcaraz‚Äôs talent and fitness, he suggested today‚Äôs field does not test players the way it once did. The remarks quickly sparked debate across the tennis world.Speaking on Spanish radio station Onda Cero, Toni Nadal made it clear he admires Carlos Alcaraz. He spoke highly of his speed, strength, and skill. Still, he added one sharp point.According to Toni, Alcaraz benefits from facing rivals who are not as dangerous as past stars.Toni compared today‚Äôs tour to matches against Juan Mart√≠n del Potro, Andy Murray, and Stan Wawrinka. He said that in those days, even a great player knew trouble was coming. A strong day from any of them could change everything.Carlos Alcaraz‚Äôs path in Melbourne included wins over Adam Walton, Yannick Hanfmann, Corentin Moutet, Tommy Paul, Alex de Minaur, and Alexander Zverev. The final test came against Novak Djokovic, who had never lost an Australian Open final before this match.The conversation also touched on Alcaraz‚Äôs growing rivalry with Jannik Sinner. Toni said he personally prefers Alcaraz, noting that their matches depend more on what Alcaraz chooses to do. However, he added that Sinner looks steadier over time.After losing to Novak Djokovic in the semifinals, Sinner is set to drop 1,200 ATP points. The gap at the top has widened, with Alcaraz now holding a clear lead in the rankings.Carlos Alcaraz, meanwhile, stayed focused on his moment. After the final, he said, ‚ÄúIt means the world to me. It is a dream come true. Nobody knows how hard I‚Äôve been working to get this trophy. I just chased this moment so much.‚ÄùWith this win, Carlos Alcaraz became only the ninth man to win all four majors. He is also the youngest to reach seven Grand Slam titles. While comparisons will continue, his story is still being written.
Article Summary: Carlos alcaraz beat novak djokovic in the australian open final on sunday. The 22-year-old became only the ninth man to win all four majors. Rafael nadal‚Äôs father, toni nadal, said the players he faced were not as strong as the ones from his own era. The remarks sparked debate across the tennis world.

Article Title: NHL Trade Rumors: Artemi Panarin ready to waive clause and join Oilers as rental if contract extension talks stall
Article Text:
Artemi Panarin trade rumors (Getty Images)

Artemi Panarin could join Oilers as a rental if extension talks collapse



Panarin + Oilers = Stanley Cup? Breaking Down the Deadline Move

Artemi Panarin‚Äôs name is once again sparking trade chatter, and the Edmonton Oilers have emerged as a front-runner in the speculation. According to insider Dave Pagnotta, Panarin could waive his no-move clause to join the Oilers as a short-term rental if contract extension talks fall through. This revelation puts Edmonton in a prime position to land one of the NHL‚Äôs most dynamic offensive talents without committing to a long-term deal.The 32-year-old winger has built a reputation as an elite playmaker capable of transforming any top-six lineup. Pagnotta noted on Oilersnation that Panarin would also consider the Colorado Avalanche or Dallas Stars in a similar rental scenario, but the Oilers‚Äô championship window makes them an especially appealing option. The potential move could dramatically alter Edmonton‚Äôs playoff outlook while giving Panarin a chance to chase a Stanley Cup in the immediate term.Panarin‚Äôs willingness to join Edmonton comes with a key caveat: this is about pursuing a championship, not reshaping a franchise. Pagnotta emphasized that this would be a ‚Äúveteran superstar‚Äôs desire to play for a Cup,‚Äù rather than a long-term, sign-and-trade arrangement.For the Oilers, pairing Panarin with Connor McDavid and Leon Draisaitl would create a virtually unstoppable top line and put enormous pressure on opposing defenses.The Oilers have consistently demonstrated they are willing to make bold moves when their championship window is open. With McDavid in his prime and Draisaitl‚Äôs scoring touch intact, Edmonton could amplify its attack immediately with Panarin‚Äôs playmaking skills. This strategic alignment makes the Oilers one of the most logical fits among potential suitors.Pagnotta also provided insights on the type of return the New York Rangers might expect. Notably, prospect Ike Howard would not be included, suggesting the Rangers are looking for a high-end rental return similar to Brock Nelson‚Äôs trade to Colorado. Such a framework allows Edmonton to make a competitive offer without sacrificing core young talent.Edmonton offers more than just offensive firepower. The team boasts an elite power play, strong centers, and a playoff-ready locker room. For a player like Panarin, this environment emphasizes immediate impact over carrying a franchise, giving him the chance to chase a Cup without long-term pressure.Colorado and Dallas present comparable opportunities, but the Oilers‚Äô combination of skill, structure, and timing could make them Panarin‚Äôs preferred destination if he chooses to waive his clause.
Article Summary: Artemi panarin could waive his no-move clause to join oilers as a short-term rental if contract extension talks fall through. The 32-year-old winger has built a reputation as an elite playmaker capable of transforming any top-six lineup.

Article Title: MLB trade rumors: Los Angeles Dodgers reported to sign $400 million Cy Young in a blockbuster deal with the Detroit Tigers; Roki Sasaki key trade asset?
Article Text:
Colorado Rockies at Los Angeles Dodgers (Image via Imagn)

Los Angeles Dodgers

(Disclaimer: The information and analysis presented in this article are based on current speculations.

While the details are sourced from credible insights, it‚Äôs important to note that these are not confirmed moves or official statements. Readers are encouraged to take this analysis with a grain of salt and stay tuned for official updates as the offseason unfolds.)

Who benefits more?

Thetrading Roki Sasaki to theforis not tied to any confirmed talks, but the idea has gained attention this offseason. The scenario reflects two teams with different priorities. Los Angeles is built to compete for titles now, while Detroit is still shaping a roster for the future.If a deal like this were completed, both pitching staffs would change immediately. The Dodgers would add one of the league‚Äôs most reliable starters, and the Tigers would receive a younger pitcher who could anchor their rotation for years. It is a classic exchange of present value for long-term control.Most projections follow a similar structure.‚Ä¢ LHP Tarik Skubal (29, entering his final pre-free-agency season in 2026).‚Ä¢ RHP Roki Sasaki (24, signed in 2025 with multiple years of team control).‚Ä¢ One or two high-level prospects, likely close to the majors.Since Skubal is approaching free agency and Detroit is not yet a clear contender, the Tigers would likely demand players who can contribute soon. Sasaki fits that requirement because he is already progressing toward a full major-league role.The Los Angeles Dodgers project strong depth with Blake Snell, Yoshinobu Yamamoto, Sasaki, and additional options such as Bobby Miller, Gavin Stone, and Michael Grove. Adding Skubal, a two-time Cy Young winner with a sub-2.00 ERA across recent seasons, would further stabilize the group.A rotation led by Skubal, Snell, and Yamamoto would give Los Angeles several postseason-caliber starters even after trading Sasaki.Tarik Skubal is projected to earn around $32 million through arbitration before becoming a free agent after the 2026 season. For the Los Angeles Dodgers, that is a manageable one-year commitment if it improves their chances of winning.Tarik Skubal enters his age-29 season and could command a contract exceeding $300 million if his performance continues. For a team still building toward contention, that level of commitment carries risk.‚Ä¢ A 29-year-old Cy Young winner nearing free agencyfor‚Ä¢ A 24-year-old starter with several years of control.Roki Sasaki‚Äôs minor-league results and brief MLB appearances point to strong strikeout ability and upper-90s velocity, though he has yet to prove himself across a full season.Detroit Tigers‚Äô reported asking price suggests the club wants multiple premium assets. A package centered on Sasaki would help rebuild organizational depth, remove a possible $30 million-plus arbitration salary, and align the roster with a later competitive window.‚Ä¢ Add a proven frontline starter.‚Ä¢ Avoid a long-term contract commitment.‚Ä¢ Maintain rotation depth.‚Ä¢ Lose a young pitcher with long-term upside.‚Ä¢ Take on a large arbitration salary.‚Ä¢ Risk losing Skubal after one season.‚Ä¢ Gain a younger starter with team control.‚Ä¢ Avoid a costly arbitration year and future contract.‚Ä¢ Add additional prospects.‚Ä¢ Trade one of the league‚Äôs top pitchers.‚Ä¢ Depend on Sasaki‚Äôs development and health.‚Ä¢ Possibly extend the rebuild timeline.The age gap explains the logic behind the proposal. Detroit would prioritize long-term value, while Los Angeles would focus on immediate results.The Dodgers would likely benefit first. A rotation featuring Skubal, Snell, and Yamamoto would raise their chances of another title.Detroit could come out ahead if Sasaki develops into a frontline starter while remaining cost-controlled through his prime.Also read: MLB trade rumors: New York Yankees potentially land $5 million Arizona Diamondbacks in a blockbuster deal to support Trent Grisham ahead of deadline Overall: The result would depend on performance and health. A championship would justify the Dodgers‚Äô decision, while Sasaki reaching ace level would make the trade a key step in Detroit‚Äôs rebuild. Both teams could meet their goals, but on different timelines.
Article Summary: The los angeles dodgers and detroit tigers could make a deal for roki sasaki. The tigers would receive a young pitcher who could anchor their rotation for years. Los angeles is built to compete for titles now, while detroit is still shaping a roster for the future.

Article Title: Magic Johnson sends touching tribute to Mark Aguirre as Dallas Mavericks honor the basketball legend
Article Text:
Magic Johnson. Image via: Vianney Le Caer / Vianney Le Caer/invision/ap

Magic Johnson sent an emotional tribute to Mark Aguirre, celebrating lifelong bond



Mark Aguirre comments on his jersey retirement



Mark Aguirre. Image via: Getty Images

Mark Aguirre recently got one of the biggest honors in his legendary basketball career. The Dallas Mavericks retired Aguirre‚Äôs No. 24 jersey to celebrate his astonishing legacy and contribution to the franchise. Just after the celebration, his long-time friend and league peer Magic Johnson sent a heartfelt note for the Mavericks legend.Los Angeles Lakers icon Johnson joined the tributes with a heartfelt post on X, revisiting their shared NBA journey. He revisited the memories of their basketball career with Aguirre as he made his name as one of the best forwards of all time.Following the announcement of Aguirre‚Äôs jersey retirement, Magic Johnson took to X to honor Mark Aguirre.‚ÄúI want to congratulate Mark Aguirre on his #24 jersey retirement with the Dallas Mavericks. I met Mark and Isiah Thomas 45 years ago after they were drafted to the NBA - we formed a friendship and started training in my hometown Lansing, MI and their hometown Chicago, IL that summer. Mark was a triple threat on the basketball court and virtually unstoppable,‚Äù Johnson wrote on X.‚ÄúLook at how good God is, all three of us now have our jerseys retired by the teams we played for - myself with the Lakers, Isiah with the Pistons, and now Mark with the Mavericks!,‚Äù he added.Aguirre‚Äôs jersey now hangs in the rafters of the Mavericks home ground, American Airlines Center. It has placed him alongside Dirk Nowitzki, Rolando Blackman, Derek Harper, and Brad Davis. He was the No. 1 overall pick in 1981.During the halftime ceremony, Aguirre addressed the crowd with emotion and gratitude. ‚ÄúDallas, I want to thank you for letting us represent you in the great NBA. Dallas is an incredible city, and you gave us the pleasure of putting on that uniform and representing you,‚Äù he said.Aguirre spent eight seasons in Dallas. During his tenure, he earned three All-Star selections and scored 13,930 points with the franchise. He later won two NBA championships with the Detroit Pistons in 1989 and 1990, finishing a 13-year career as one of the league‚Äôs most reliable scorers of his era.
Article Summary: The dallas mavericks retired mark aguirre‚Äôs no. 24 jersey to celebrate his astonishing legacy and contribution to the franchise. Magic johnson sent an emotional tribute to the mavericks legend, revisiting their shared nba journey.

Article Title: Once declined by Bangladesh, now calling the shots: When no one wanted to visit Pakistan
Article Text:
Pakistani fans holding a large flag cheer during the match (Photo by AP)

Former captain Rashid Latif on Pakistan boycotting India T20 World Cup match

Players of Pakistan unveil ICC T20 World Cup 2026 jersey (Photo by Sameer Ali/Getty Images)

Family members light candles as they pay tribute to martyrs of the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack, at the Gateway of India, in Mumbai, Maharashtra. (PTI Photo)

Pakistan beat Australia in T20Is 3-0 (AP Photo/K.M. Chaudary)

ALSO READ:

NEW DELHI: Some will call it ruckus. Some will call it a mess. Others will simply call it chaos. The words may change, but the situation remains the same. Cricket, once again, finds itself caught between politics, security fears and unfinished business.On Sunday, the Pakistan government confirmed that its national cricket team will take part in the ICC Men‚Äôs T20 World Cup 2026. But there was a major catch. Pakistan will not play its group match against arch-rivals India, scheduled for February 15. The announcement came through the government‚Äôs official X handle.It said, ‚ÄúThe government ... grants approval to the Pakistan cricket team to participate in the ICC World T20 2026, however, the Pakistan Cricket Team shall not take the field in the match scheduled on 15th February 2026 against India.‚ÄùThe reason is not new. Pakistan has maintained a policy of not touring India due to geopolitical tensions.Because of this, Pakistan‚Äôs Group A matches have been scheduled in Sri Lanka.But refusing to play a single match in a global tournament has raised serious questions about the spirit of competition.The International Cricket Council (ICC) reacted firmly.In a statement, it said, ‚ÄúThe ICC notes the statement that the government of Pakistan has made regarding the decision to instruct its national team to selectively participate in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026.‚ÄùThe governing body made its discomfort clear, adding, ‚ÄúThis position of selective participation is difficult to reconcile with the fundamental premise of a global sporting event where all qualified teams are expected to compete on equal terms per the event schedule.‚ÄùWhile it is rare for Pakistan to be the side raising questions, history shows it has more often been the team affected by others refusing to tour. Over the years, several international sides have cancelled or declined tours to Pakistan, mostly due to security concerns.One of the earliest major setbacks came in 2008, when New Zealand cancelled a scheduled tour to Pakistan. Political instability and safety concerns made the visitors uncomfortable.That cancellation was an early sign that touring Pakistan was becoming increasingly difficult.Australia followed the same path in 2008. The Australians decided not to tour Pakistan, citing serious security concerns. Instead, parts of the series were moved to neutral venues.For Pakistan cricket, this was another blow. Hosting matches at home was becoming impossible, and fans were being denied the chance to see top teams play on their soil.After the their 2008 tour, India stopped travelling to Pakistan for bilateral cricket due to worsening political relations and security concerns, especially following the Mumbai terror attacks later that year.Since then, India and Pakistan have only faced each other in ICC tournaments or Asia Cups, mostly at neutral venues, with bilateral series remaining suspended.The situation worsened dramatically in 2009. The Sri Lankan team was attacked in Lahore while travelling to a Test match.Several people were injured, and lives were lost.That incident changed everything. After the attack, international teams stayed away from Pakistan for years.Home series were shifted to the UAE. Pakistan became a team without a home.Bangladesh also refused to tour Pakistan in 2012. Once again, security fears were the reason.While Bangladesh later returned for limited tours, the refusal added to Pakistan‚Äôs growing list of cancelled series.Even when things seemed to improve, trouble returned. In 2021, New Zealand abandoned its tour to Pakistan just minutes before the first match.The decision came after what was described as ‚Äúsecurity advice‚Äù. The sudden withdrawal shocked players, fans and officials. Stadiums were ready. Crowds were waiting. But cricket never happened.England followed soon after. In 2021, both the men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs England teams cancelled their tours of Pakistan.Player safety was cited as the main reason.For Pakistan, it was a painful reminder that trust takes years to build and seconds to lose.These incidents show a clear pattern, with major international teams declining or cancelling tours to Pakistan.Most of these decisions were linked to security concerns.The long absence of international cricket forced Pakistan to rebuild its image slowly.Over time, teams like Zimbabwe, Sri Lanka, New Zealand, South Africa, and also Australia returned, helping Pakistan inch back into the global cricket map.But the situation has changed now.Pakistan once pleaded for teams to tour its country. Now, it is choosing not to play its most high-profile match in a global event. The context is different.Whether this standoff ends in compromise or conflict remains to be seen. For now, the ruckus continues. And once again, cricket waits on the sidelines.
Article Summary: Pakistan will not play its group match against arch-rivals india, scheduled for february 15. Pakistan has maintained a policy of not touring india due to geopolitical tensions. Pakistan‚Äôs group a matches have been scheduled in sri lanka. The international cricket council (icc) reacted firmly.

Article Title: Despite Cameron Green's 'chucking' gesture, Usman Khawaja defends Pakistan bowler - 'Stigma is real'
Article Text:
Cameron Green‚Äôs angry reaction to Usman Tariq (Screengrabs)

Former captain Rashid Latif on Pakistan boycotting India T20 World Cup match

NEW DELHI: Former Australia batter Usman Khawaja has publicly come out in support of Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq after controversy erupted during the second T20I between Australia and Pakistan last week.The issue began when Australian all-rounder Cameron Green , after getting out to Tariq, was seen making a gesture on live television that many viewers interpreted as suggesting ‚Äúchucking‚Äù.The clip quickly went viral and sparked heated debate on social media.Usman Tariq, 28, has faced scrutiny over his bowling action in the past. His action was reported twice during the Pakistan Super League , but on both occasions he was cleared after undergoing official testing. Despite this, Green‚Äôs gesture reopened the discussion, with opinions sharply divided online.Khawaja, who retired from international cricket after the fifth Ashes Test in January 2026, stepped in to defend the Pakistani spinner.Taking to Instagram Stories, he urged fans to show restraint and empathy. ‚ÄúThere aren‚Äôt many things worse than being called a chucker in cricket. The stigma is real. The man is just doing his best and has been cleared twice.Let‚Äôs have some perspective and understanding and stop jumping to conclusions,‚Äù he wrote.Tariq himself has earlier explained the reason behind his action. He said a biological condition in his elbow makes it difficult to fully straighten his arm, which can sometimes look misleading to spectators.‚ÄúThere are two corners on my elbow which make it hard for me to straighten. That causes confusion for the spectators. I have given two tests at labs in Pakistan. My action was cleared,‚Äù Tariq said. He added, ‚ÄúI was confident about my action because I know that I am not throwing.‚ÄùOn the field, Tariq has delivered solid performances. In his lone T20I appearance against Australia, he picked up figures of 2/16. He is part of Pakistan‚Äôs T20 World Cup squad and is expected to play a key role when the tournament begins on February 7 against the Netherlands.Pakistan recently swept a depleted Australian side 3-0 in the T20I series, after which both teams travelled to Sri Lanka for the World Cup, leaving the controversy behind but the debate still alive.
Article Summary: Usman khawaja has publicly come out in support of pakistan spinner usman tariq. The controversy erupted during the second t20i between australia and pakistan last week. Australian all-rounder cameron green was seen making a gesture on live television that many viewers interpreted as suggesting ‚Äúchucking‚Äù the clip quickly went viral and sparked heated debate on social media.

Article Title: No ICC meeting yet as Pakistan's boycott threat clouds India clash at T20 World Cup
Article Text:
Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

'Cricket Or Cowardice?' Opposition MPs Lash BCCI After Pakistan Boycott India Clash In T20 World Cup

Former captain Rashid Latif on Pakistan boycotting India T20 World Cup match

Poll Do you think the ICC should impose sanctions on the PCB for the boycott of the T20 match against India? Yes, absolutely No, it's their right to boycott Maybe, depends on the circumstances

NEW DELHI: While speculation is rife about the sanctions the International Cricket Council (ICC) could potentially levy on the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) following the Pakistan government‚Äôs decision to boycott the T20 World Cup group match against India on February 15, no concrete steps have yet been taken by the global body to address the issue.According to a report by ESPNcricinfo, any discussion on sanctions would ordinarily take place at an ICC Board meeting, which comprises representatives from the 12 Full Member boards, three Associate Member representatives and the ICC chair. However, the ICC has not so far alerted its Board about any emergency meeting to deliberate on the matter. The report added that the PCB has also indicated it is unlikely to formally respond in writing to the ICC regarding the boycott or the reasons behind the government‚Äôs stance.As things stand, the status quo continues around Pakistan‚Äôs threat to skip the high-profile February 15 match in Colombo. Despite strong statements from the ICC that it will not tolerate selective participation, there is no indication yet of an imminent Board-level discussion.A Cricbuzz report also echoed similar sentiments, stating that there are 16 members on the ICC Board and, according to multiple directors spoken to by the publication, there is no information about any Board meeting being scheduled.Crucially, the report noted that the PCB has not formally written to the ICC about forfeiting the India game. At present, the only written indication of the boycott is an X post from the Government of Pakistan, which does not constitute official communication.Cricbuzz further reported that there is a growing impression that the PCB may eventually fall in line. It cited last year‚Äôs Asia Cup , when Pakistan confirmed participation in a match barely half an hour before the start after threatening to pull out through the day.The ICC, meanwhile, has reiterated its position, stating that selective participation ‚Äúis difficult to reconcile‚Äù with the principles of sporting integrity, competitiveness and fairness that underpin ICC events, warning that such actions undermine the spirit and sanctity of global tournaments.
Article Summary: Pakistan government to boycott t20 world cup group match against india on february 15. No concrete steps have yet been taken by the icc to address the issue. Any discussion on sanctions would ordinarily take place at an icc board meeting. Icc has not so far alerted its board about any emergency meeting to deliberate on the matter.

Article Title: Is Joel Embiid playing tonight vs Los Angeles Clippers? Latest injury updates on Philadelphia 76ers star ahead of Monday‚Äôs clash
Article Text:
Joel Embiid. Image via: Getty Images

Will Joel Embiid play tonight against the Los Angeles Clippers?

What is Joel Embiid‚Äôs injury all about?

On Monday, the Philadelphia 76ers are set to clash with the Los Angeles Clippers at 10 pm ET. The key question that lingers on everyone‚Äôs mind is whether the 76ers' star player, Joel Embiid, is going to play in tonight‚Äôs game. With Clippers players like Kris Dunn and Kawhi Leonard, Embiid‚Äôs presence is crucial for Monday‚Äôs match against their opponent. The 76ers have won three straight games, and tonight can be their fourth win.Joel Embiid is known for his versatility and smooth ball-handling skills. However, even without Embiid, the 76ers still have players like Tyrese Maxey and VJ Edgecombe. Although suffering from an ankle injury, his presence would prove to be an asset for the team, but can he actually play tonight, or would he be a liability for his team? Here is everything you need to know about Joel Embiid‚Äôs latest injury updates and whether he will be available for tonight‚Äôs clash.According to the injury reports by ESPN, Joel Embiid has been listed as ‚Äúprobable‚Äù, and that might sabotage the 76ers' game tonight. As his presence for tonight is questionable, implying that he should be available. Embiid has appeared in 28 games this season, averaging 26.2 points, 7.5 rebounds, 3.9 assists, and 1.1 blocks per game. With such amazing stats, the team could have it all. However, they still have dependable players like Maxey and Edgecombe, who could turn the tables and bring the team one step closer to the NBA FinalsAlthough tonight‚Äôs match favors the Clippers, James Harden‚Äôs presence is also questionable for the clash against the 76ers.If somehow Embiid plays the game, his point could prove to be beneficial for the team and himself. However, his presence tonight doesn‚Äôt guarantee the 76ers an easy win since their power forward, Paul George, is on the loose from the depth chart due to felony charges.As of late December 2025, Joel Embiid has been suffering from a right ankle sprain, which has caused him to miss an ample amount of games this season. Although his injury marks as an ‚Äúassociated injury management‚Äù, he is still recovering from the same, and therefore his presence for tonight‚Äôs game is still questionable. Embiid‚Äôs scores have been a hit since the beginning of the 2025-2026 season, but his injury might cost him his MVP position this time.
Article Summary: The philadelphia 76ers are set to clash with the los angeles clippers at 10 pm et on monday. The key question that lingers on everyone‚Äôs mind is whether the 76ers' star player, joel embiid, is going to play in tonight's game. Although suffering from an ankle injury, his presence would prove to be an asset for the team, but can he actually play tonight?

Kayla Nicole‚Äôs alleged controversial moment takes a dig at Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce‚Äôs relationship.(Image via Getty Images/ Taylor Swift/Instagram)

Kayla Nicole has been accused of dissing Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce even before

Article Title: Patrick Mahomes faces growing pressure as Chiefs brace for possible roster shakeup
Article Text:
Patrick Mahomes (Image Via Getty)

Travis Kelce future and free agency pressure push Kansas City Chiefs into hard roster calls

The warning signs around the Kansas City Chiefs are hard to miss right now. This is not about panic or headlines. It is about reality setting in. Injuries over the past season, mixed with tight finances, have exposed weak spots the team cannot ignore anymore. When a franchise known for control and consistency starts facing tough calls, fans naturally pay attention.At the center of everything is Patrick Mahomes . His injury scare last year reminded everyone how quickly things can change, even for elite teams. At the same time, Kansas City is staring at a long list of contracts coming to an end. With limited cap space and free agency approaching, every decision feels heavier. This offseason is less about adding stars and more about deciding who stays and who walks as 2026 gets closer.The biggest question starts with Travis Kelce. At 36, he is still producing at a high level, finishing last season with more than 800 receiving yards and five touchdowns.Still, retirement is a real option. Chiefs owner Clark Hunt has said the team is giving Kelce time and space to make his decision.‚ÄúAs an organization, we certainly hope that he will come back,‚Äù Hunt said. ‚ÄúHe had another great year. He is still a key leader for us, and we believe he can still play at a high level.‚ÄùKelce has hinted that returning is something he wants, especially with Eric Bieniemy back in a familiar role. But emotion does not decide contracts.Kelce‚Äôs salary has a direct effect on how the Chiefs manage the rest of the roster. One move here changes several moves elsewhere.Beyond Kelce, uncertainty spreads quickly. Veterans like Kareem Hunt and Tyquan Thornton could test the open market. On defense, younger players such as Bryan Cook and Leo Chenal are drawing strong interest around the league.Their rising value makes keeping them harder, even though they are important to the team‚Äôs future. The Chiefs do have draft picks and some cap flexibility, but not enough to keep everyone.That means restructures, tough conversations, and possibly letting familiar faces leave. The goal remains clear.Protect Patrick Mahomes, keep the core competitive, and make sure Kansas City does not lose ground in a league that moves fast and waits for no one.
Article Summary: Travis kelce, kareem hunt and tyquan thornton could test the open market. The chiefs do have draft picks and some cap flexibility, but not enough to keep everyone. The goal remains clear. Protect patrick mahomes, keep the core competitive, and make sure kansas city does not lose ground in a league that moves fast and waits for no one.

Article Title: Why Marvel is skipping the Super Bowl 2026 and how it impacts Avengers: Doomsday and Spider-Man: Brand New Day
Article Text:
Image- X

Spider-Man: Brand New Day

Avengers: Doomsday

Marvel and the Super Bowl: a long history of big-game marketing

Deadpool & Wolverine

Thunderbolts

Why Marvel may be sitting this one out

There are several reasons analysts point to for Marvel‚Äôs decision to skip Super Bowl ads in 2026:

A 30-second Super Bowl spot this year reportedly commands upwards of ~$10 million.

Both Brand New Day (July 31 release) and Avengers: Doomsday (December 18) are many months away. Marvel might prefer to unveil trailers closer to their actual release windows rather than so far in advance.

Avengers: Doomsday

Spider-Man: Brand New Day

The Mandalorian & Grogu

Toy Story 5

Hoppers

Super Mario Galaxy Movie

Scream 7

This year Super Bowl LX will not have one big franchise promoting themselves, Marvel Studios isn‚Äôt planning any commercials or trailer debuts for its major upcoming movies during the broadcast. According to industry reporting, neithernorwill air a trailer or ad spot during the NFL‚Äôs biggest night.Marvel and Sony appear to have opted out of Super Bowl advertising this year, a break from past tradition. If this is true, this marks a notable shift in how Marvel is approaching its blockbuster marketing and so is Super Bowl ad space.For years, Marvel promoted their movies via Super Bowl trailers and commercials. Past MCU titles likeandpremiered teasers or ads during the game and generated massive global attention from it.Super Bowl commercials have long been praised for their unmatched live audience, often over 100 million viewers and the way a well-timed trailer can dominate entertainment news cycles. Fans now associate the Big Game with exclusive looks at major Hollywood films. That connection makes Marvel‚Äôs absence this year more striking.Marvel‚Äôs global brand may generate enough year-round buzz without needing a Big Game push.Some industry observers say its core fanbase will seek out trailers online regardless of a Super Bowl spot.These could be the potential reasons for them not opting for a Super Bowl ad this year, it‚Äôs recalibrating when and where it spends its marketing dollars.Even without Super Bowl advertising, Marvel‚Äôs marketing cycle is already underway.has seen several teaser releases over the past months, andis likely to get a full trailer in the coming weeks or months.Other studios and franchises are taking advantage of the Super Bowl‚Äôs massive audience, titles like, andare expected to debut spots during the game.
Article Summary: Marvel and sony appear to have opted out of super bowl advertising this year, a break from past tradition. A 30-second super bowl spot this year reportedly commands upwards of $10 million. Marvel might prefer to unveil trailers closer to their actual release windows rather than so far in advance.

Article Title: Bill Belichick reportedly blames ‚Äúpolitics‚Äù for his Hall of Fame snub as Jordan Hudson plans an expensive party for him
Article Text:
Bill Belichick reportedly blames ‚Äúpolitics‚Äù for his Hall of Fame snub as Jordan Hudson plans an expensive party.(Image via Getty Images)

Bill Belichick reportedly feels upset as his girlfriend, Jordan Hudson , tries to cheer him up



Tom Brady seems pretty angry about Bill Belichick‚Äôs situation



Bill Belichick, the 73 year old North Carolina Tar Heels coach, has had a rough couple of days after he lost out on entering the Pro Football Hall of Fame, a few days ago.While many NFL players and fans of Bill Belichick‚Äôs have expressed their anger over such a decision, many remained curious about how the veteran coach must be feeling. New reports have revealed what Bill Belichick has felt over the last few days.A few days ago, as per ESPN, a source close to Bill Belichick revealed that, "Politics kept him out. He doesn't believe this is a reflection on his accomplishments."The source also added how Bill Belichick has expressed his frustration about winning six Super Bowls and yet losing out on entering the Pro Football Hall of Fame.However, neither the 73 year old North Carolina Tar Heels coach Bill Belichick, nor his 24 year old girlfriend, Jordan Hudson, has commented on the drama publicly as they remain silent.While Bill Belichick seems to be pretty upset, as per PEOPLE, new reports claim that Jordon Hudson is planning a big party to celebrate him after he lost out on entering the Pro Football Hall of Fame.Bill Belichick‚Äôs Hall of Fame snub has sparked outrage in the league with many NFL legends expressing their anger over this situation.As Tom Brady made an appearance on a Seattle radio show, he said, "I don't understand it.I was with him every day. If he's not a first-ballot Hall of Famer, there's really no coach that should ever be a first-ballot Hall of Famer.‚ÄùThe NFL legend added, ‚ÄúWhich is completely ridiculous, because people deserve it. He's incredible. There's no coach I'd rather play for. If I'm taking one coach to go out there to win a Super Bowl, give me one season, I'm taking Bill Belichick. So, that's enough said."Bill Belichick has yet to respond to these statements as he remains away from the public eye.
Article Summary: Bill belichick reportedly blames ‚Äúpolitics‚Äù for his hall of fame snub as jordan hudson plans an expensive party. Bill belichick reportedly feels upset as his girlfriend, jordan hudson, tries to cheer him up. New reports claim that jordon hudson is planning a big party to celebrate him after he lost out on entering the pro footballhall of fame.

Article Title: Veteran goaltender Marc-Andre Fleury shuts down NHL comeback rumors amid team interest
Article Text:
Marc-Andre Fleury reaffirms his retirement despite rumors of his return to the league (Image via Getty Images) Marc-Andre Fleury reaffirms his retirement despite rumors of his return to the league (Image via Getty Images) Marc-Andre Fleury reaffirms his retirement despite rumors of his return to the league (Image via Getty Images) Marc-Andre Fleury reaffirms his retirement despite rumors of his return to the league (Image via Getty Images) Marc-Andre Fleury reaffirms his retirement despite rumors of his return to the league (Image via Getty Images) 1

2

Marc-Andre Fleury dismisses NHL comeback rumor, reaffirms his stance on retirement

(Source: Sportskeeda)

Veteran goaltender Marc-Andre Fleury has firmly dismissed speculation related to his NHL comeback. He has also reaffirmed his commitment to retirement, crushing the speculations about his return to the NHL. Earlier, the Pittsburgh Penguins‚Äô goalie returned to Pittsburgh for one final match, donning the Black & Gold jersey, referring to his farewell to the sport.According to the NHL, Marc-Andre Fleury was selected by the Pittsburgh Penguins with the No. 1 pick in the 2003 NHL Draft. He became the third goalie to be chosen first, after Michel Plasse of the Montreal Canadiens and Rick DiPietro of the New York Islanders.Fleury ended the calendar year of 2023 by becoming the fourth goalie in NHL history to play at least 1,000 games, joining Martin Brodeur (1,266), Roberto Luongo (1,044), and Patrick Roy (1,029), making 26 saves in a 3-2 loss to the Winnipeg Jets. Veteran Pittsburgh Penguins goaltender Marc-Andre Fleury has reaffirmed his commitment to retirement, dismissing speculation about returning to the NHL despite team interest. According to reports, Fleury addressed the rumors directly during a Pittsburgh Penguins reunion event on Saturday. He stated during the event, "No, no chance. I'm happy like this."Also, speaking to USA Today Sports, Fleury stated, ‚ÄúI had some calls, and I took the time to think about it. It's very nice of them to think of me in that way, very flattering, but then at the end of the day, I stopped playing for some reasons.I thought it was better to just stay on the sidelines.‚ÄùMeanwhile, The Athletic‚Äôs Josh Yohe also said, ‚ÄúI‚Äôve spoken with Fleury and several people close to him in recent weeks, and while I don‚Äôt doubt he misses life in the NHL, I don‚Äôt think we‚Äôll see him playing in the league again. The Flower seems very content in retirement, and I take him at his word.‚ÄùSince stepping away from the league, Fleury briefly returned to international competition at the World Championships before joining the Penguins on a professional tryout last year, even taking the ice in a preseason game at PPG Paints Arena.Before bidding goodbye, Fleury also won his 490th game on May 5, making 26 saves in a 3-2 overtime win against the Minnesota Wild to move past Luongo for third in NHL history.Fleury's NHL career came to an end after 21 seasons in the Wild's 3-2 loss to the Golden Knights in Game 6 of the Western Conference First Round at Xcel Energy Center on May 1. He was second in League history at the time in victories (575), games played (1,051), and time on ice (60,669:03). It is said that the goalie would join Canada for the 2025 IIHF World Championship.
Article Summary: Pittsburgh penguins goaltender marc-andre fleury has firmly dismissed speculation related to his nhl comeback. Fleury's nhl career came to an end after 21 seasons in the wild's 3-2 loss to the golden knights in game 6 of the western conference first round on may 1.

Article Title: Blue Jays unveil plans for Joe Carter statue outside the Rogers Center as part of 50th anniversary
Article Text:
Joe Carter (Image Source: Getty)

Joe Carter‚Äôs legendary moments and achievements

Celebrating Joe Carter‚Äôs milestone for franchising and anniversary details

The Blue Jays' decision to build a Joe Carter statue creates a powerful symbolic gesture. The team establishes a permanent legacy through the bronze dedication of Carter. This will allow future fans to witness the moment that brought Toronto its second championship title. The monument will serve a dual purpose for future supporters because it will both remind people of the Blue Jays' golden era and inspire them to achieve great things. The organization honors Carter because he represents not only a player but also the pure competitive spirit.The club used a video announcement to present the news, which showed Carter receiving surprise visitors who included former team president Paul Beeston and current president Mark Shapiro. Carter believed he was going to a normal meeting and learned that his achievements would be honored with a permanent display outside the stadium. The reveal shows Carter's emotional response to his Blue Jays achievement that he maintained throughout his career.The team has launched a special anniversary logo, which players will wear on their uniforms together with the Carter tribute and scheduled themed events throughout the upcoming year.The Rogers Centre has received substantial renovations during its recent seasons, which include improved fan areas, and these enhancements make the statue an appropriate addition to the newly updated ballpark.Carter's statue serves as a tribute to one player for fans because it represents the franchise's most successful period. The organization uses its dedication to its history as a commitment to its future goals. The statue exists as a fan request, which Shapiro confirmed would attract a maximum audience during the anniversary celebration, according to his statement. The Blue Jays' 50th anniversary celebration marks a significant milestone for the baseball team with which every Canadian involved with the sport should feel some shade of kinship. Carter's statue will serve as a national monument that showcases Toronto's baseball achievements while displaying the city's determination to succeed.The Joe Carter statue represents more than a monument at this time because it exists as a permanent tribute to the Blue Jays' history, which reveals its most important moment at a time that will create both nostalgia and fan enthusiasm.
Article Summary: The blue jays' decision to build a joe carter statue creates a powerful symbolic gesture. The team establishes a permanent legacy through the bronze dedication of carter. This will allow future fans to witness the moment that brought toronto its second championship title.

Article Title: Detroit Pistons shatter franchise record in a 53-point brutal win over Brooklyn Nets
Article Text:
Jalen Duren (Brian Sevald / National Basketball Association / Getty)

Detroit Pistons break the franchise record with the biggest win margin

Brooklyn Nets' struggles do not seem to stop



DauneThe Detroit Pistons made franchise history on February 1, 2026, after delivering a 130‚Äì77 brutal victory over the Brooklyn Nets at the Little Caesars Arena. The 53-point margin win officially stands as the franchise‚Äôs most dominant one-sided match in its history. This surpassed the organization's 52-point record set against the Boston Celtics in January 2003 where the win registered a 118‚Äì66 win.Pistons are currently leading the Eastern Conference with a 36‚Äì12 record, and are on a two game winning streak.The Pistons hosted the Nets on Sunday Night and handed the latter their second worst loss of this season after their 66-120 loss against the Knicks in late January. But for Detroit this victory was bejewelled by the newly minted All-Star pair, Jalen Duren and Cade Cunningham. Duren received news of his first-ever All-Star selection as an Eastern Conference reserve just before tip-off, and seems to have celebrated the milestone with 21 points, 10 rebounds and 3 assets against Nets while shooting 8-13 from the field and 5-6 from the free throw line.Cunningham after being 2025 selected as a reserve last season is finally making his debut as a starter this All-Star season. He ended the night with 18 points, 12 assists, 4 rebounds and 4 steals, while going 7-11 from the field and 1-4 from the three point line.Under Cunningham‚Äôs leadership, the Pistons raced to a 67‚Äì44 lead by half time fueled by Ausar Thompson half-court buzzer-beater. Detroit‚Äôs efficiency as a team was on full display as they shot 56.5% (48-of-85) from the field while committing only eight turnovers. Whereas the Nets had 23 turnovers. The Nets couldn't overcome Pistory‚Äôs defense and were restricted to a combined total of 33 points in the 3 and 4th quarter whereas the Pistons dropped 63.The Brooklyn Nets are currently at the last 3rd place in the Eastern conference with a 13‚Äì35 record. After a 7-game losing streak they finally registered a 109-99 win over the Jazz in their last meet up and hoped to finally change the momentum but Pistons didn‚Äôt agree with this idea.The Nets only managed to attempt 73 shots from the field while converting only 24 of those (32.9%) while they went 7-of-31 from the arc. Cam Thomas and rookie Drake Powell led the night as Nets highest scorer with 12 points each. For their next match up the Nets will host the West‚Äôs Lakers (29-19), whereas the Detroit Pistons also prepare to host the Denver Nuggets (33-17) on Tuesday.
Article Summary: Detroit pistons break the franchise record with the biggest win margin. The 53-point margin win officially stands as the franchise‚Äôs most dominant one-sided match in its history. This surpassed the organization's 52-point record set against the boston celtics in january 2003 where the win registered a 118‚Äì66 win.

Article Title: NHL legend Joe Sakic reflects on Olympic glory as Colorado Avalanche stars prepare for Milan
Article Text:
NHL legend and Gold Medalist, Joe Sakic (Via Getty Images)

Winning at Olympics meant something very special for Joe Sakic as part of Team Canada

There are moments from Salt Lake City 2002 that remain frozen in Joe Sakic's memory. The roar of the crowd. The teammates were screaming in celebration. The breakaway goal that sealed Olympic gold and ended Canada's 50-year drought in men's hockey.The Avalanche legend scored twice and added four points total in the gold medal game victory over Team USA before being named the tournament MVP. But when asked recently about what made the Olympics special, Sakic immediately went somewhere else entirely.By the time the 2002 Winter Olympics rolled in, Sakic was already a two-time Stanley Cup champion with the Avs, having won his second championship just months before in 2001. His trophy case was already filled to the brim, including the 1996 Conn Smythe and 2001 Hart Memorial trophies.In fact, that Olympic gold wasn‚Äôt even his first international title, as in 1994 he led the national side to the 1994 IIHF World Championships, in the process ending Team Canada‚Äôs 33-year gold medal drought. But that tournament in Utah remains deeply personal to him."Playing in an Olympic Games, you represent your country," Sakic told The Athletic."You get to experience it, be part of the Olympic village, the whole Olympic atmosphere. You go check out other events on off days. You're training with the other athletes. It was just an amazing experience to be part of that."Now serving as president of hockey operations for the Avalanche, Sakic will watch his twin superstars experience what he once did. Nathan MacKinnon and Cale Makar , along with defensive partner Devon Toews, will wear the Olympic Maple Leaf when the NHL returns to the Olympics after a 12-year absence.The timing could not be better for MacKinnon, who is having a Hart Trophy-caliber season and is the first player in the NHL to reach 40 goals. He was named MVP at the 4 Nations Face-Off last February and enters Milan riding elite form."Everybody knows how great Nate is, what a great competitor he is," Sakic said. "He's a winner. The Olympics are the showcase for the world, and the rest of the world will see how great a hockey player he is. Same for Cale."The opportunity extends beyond individual glory. Sakic understands the importance of exposing NHL talent to a global audience that has missed Olympic hockey for more than a decade. "The NHL hasn't been there in 12 years," he said."There will be a whole new generation of kids around the world that get to see how good these players are." The Avalanche sit atop the Central Division with a 36-8-9 record as the Olympic break approaches. Competition begins February 11 in Milan.
Article Summary: Joe sakic was part of team canada's gold-medal winning team at the 2002 winter olympics in salt lake city. Sakic is now president of hockey operations for the colorado avalanche. The nhl returns to the olympics for the first time in 12 years on february 11.

Article Title: Who is Marie-Philip Poulin? The Canadian ice hockey star carries the nation into a new Olympic Era
Article Text:
Marie-Philip Poulin (via Getty Images)

Marie-Philip Poulin keeps her head up ahead of Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics 2026

One-on-one with Marie-Philip Poulin ahead of her fifth Olympic Winter Games | #CBCSports

Marie-Philip Poulin is on her way to a fifth Olympic Games, but this time the build-up feels very different. After scoring in Montreal Victoire‚Äôs 3-0 win over the Toronto Sceptres on Wednesday night, the Canadian captain is flying to Italy the very next day. In past Olympic cycles, that timing would have been unthinkable. Now, it reflects how women‚Äôs hockey has changed.The launch of the Professional Women‚Äôs Hockey League has transformed Olympic preparation for Canada and the United States. Instead of a long six-month training block, players are shifting quickly from league games to international competition. The rhythm now feels closer to the NHL model. Poulin says the routine is new, but she believes it can still be a strong way to prepare for the biggest stage.Marie-Philip Poulin‚Äôs journey is defined by clutch moments and leadership. Rising from Beauceville to Olympic glory, she became Canada‚Äôs trusted captain, scoring historic gold-medal winners and shaping the growth of women‚Äôs hockey, from national dominance to helping build the professional league era.Marie-Philip Poulin explained that in previous years, the team would never play a game the night before traveling.Still, she believes playing and training with top players every day has real value. She feels the change is different, but not negative. For her, constant high-level competition helps sharpen focus before the Olympics.Canada head coach Troy Ryan is adjusting to the change as well. In earlier Olympic cycles, he worked closely with the team over several months. This time, he will have only a few days with the full roster before Canada opens against Finland on February 5.The PWHL is also helping players from other countries close the gap. Montreal forward Natalie Mlynkova, who will represent Czechia, said training daily against elite players is a major advantage. She believes her national team has grown a lot over the past four years and wants to challenge the top nations.After Wednesday‚Äôs game, Olympic-bound players from both teams were honored on the ice. As reported by Canadian Press , Poulin said it was special to see athletes heading to represent different countries together. She noted that growing the game is a shared goal, even if players wear different jerseys at the Olympics.
Article Summary: Marie-philip poulin is on her way to a fifth olympic games, but this time the build-up feels very different. The launch of the professional women‚Äôs hockey league has transformed olympic preparation for canada and the u.s. Instead of a long six-month training block, players are shifting from league games to international competition.

Article Title: Brittany Mahomes celebrates UT Tyler Hall of Fame honor as her college legacy comes full circle
Article Text:
Brittany Mahomes (via Imagn Images)

A record-setting soccer career and gratitude for the mentors who shaped her

The NFL season did not end the way the Kansas City Chiefs hoped, but the Mahomes family has now found a reason to celebrate. Brittany Mahomes received a major honor from a place that helped shape her long before life in the spotlight. On Friday, the University of Texas at Tyler announced its Athletics Hall of Fame class for 2026, and Brittany‚Äôs name stood out among the inductees.Mahomes, known during her college years as Brittany Matthews, played women‚Äôs soccer for the UT Tyler Patriots from 2013 to 2016. She finished her career second all-time in total points with 78 and goals with 31. Her senior season remains one of the best the program has seen, as she recorded 40 points and 18 goals, numbers that still stand as a benchmark.UT Tyler also announced former Director of Athletics Dr. Howard Patterson and the 2016 softball national championship team as part of the same Hall of Fame class. Brittany‚Äôs induction highlights the growing legacy of UT Tyler athletics and the athletes who helped elevate it on a national level.In a statement shared through the university, Brittany reflected on the impact of her college experience. She stated, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm honored to be inducted into the UT Tyler Athletics Hall of Fame. My time at UT Tyler played a huge role in shaping my life, career, and the person I am today.‚Äù She also made a point to credit longtime women‚Äôs soccer head coach Stefani Webb for her guidanceShe added, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm especially grateful to Coach Webb‚Äîher belief in me, leadership, and constant support had an incredible impact on my journey both on and off the field.UT Tyler will always hold a special place in my heart. I‚Äôm so thankful for the experiences and the people who were part of making my time in Tyler one I will never forget.‚ÄùThe celebration extended beyond Brittany herself as her mother-in-law, Randi Mahomes, shared her excitement on Instagram Stories, reposting the university‚Äôs announcement and writing, ‚ÄúGO @BRITTANYLYNNE!!!‚Äù with a heart emoji. Brittany is scheduled to be formally inducted into the UT Tyler Athletics Hall of Fame on March 28.
Article Summary: Brittany mahomes played women‚Äôs soccer for the ut tyler patriots from 2013 to 2016. She finished her career second all-time in total points with 78 and goals with 31. The university of texas at tyler announced its athletics hall of fame class for 2026.

Article Title: "I tried to talk him out of it": Ex-Ravens head coach John Harbaugh admits he tried to stop Todd Monken from joining the Browns
Article Text:
John Harbaugh reveals late effort to keep Todd Monken away from Browns.Image via: Getty

John Harbaugh nearly pulled Todd Monken away



The Cleveland Browns finally closed their head coaching search, but it did not come without a few nervous moments. After weeks of interviews and speculation, the team hired Todd Monken, a decision that brings optimism on offense but also reminds fans how close Cleveland came to missing out altogether. For Browns fans, the hire feels like both a relief and a gamble. Monken was never viewed as the clear favorite, and there was a real sense that his strong ties elsewhere could pull him away late in the process. Cleveland stayed aggressive, and that persistence ended up making the difference.The biggest threat to Cleveland‚Äôs plans came from John Harbaugh, who openly admitted he tried to keep Monken from leaving. Speaking to NJ Advanced Media, Harbaugh shared just how hard he pushed. "I tried to talk him out of it... that's my job, right?"Harbaugh made it clear the situation was far from settled until the very end. "I really thought he was coming with us, but Cleveland was in there all along," Harbaugh shared. "He'd been there before in 2019 as the offensive coordinator, so they knew him and he wanted this opportunity. He got it, and I'm happy for him. I'm really proud of him, but we've got to go to work."Those comments help explain why the Browns‚Äô coaching search felt so uneasy from the outside. Many fans believed Monken would stay in Harbaugh‚Äôs orbit or possibly join the New York Giants.Instead, Cleveland leaned on familiarity, trusting their previous experience with Monken and selling him on the chance to run his own program. While some fans questioned the hire, Harbaugh‚Äôs words offer reassurance. Monken was a major driver behind Baltimore‚Äôs offensive success in recent seasons. In 2024, the Ravens led the league in total yards and rushing yards while ranking near the top in scoring. Even when injuries slowed the unit in 2025, the offense remained productive and competitive.That track record is why Cleveland believes Monken can bring stability to an offense that has lacked identity. His arrival also puts the spotlight on the quarterback position, especially with Shedeur Sanders now viewed as a key piece of the franchise‚Äôs future.Monken‚Äôs ability to build around Sanders and bring consistency will likely define how this hire is judged. For now, the Browns avoided a late collapse in their coaching search and landed a respected offensive mind. The uncertainty is gone. The pressure, however, is just getting started.
Article Summary: John harbaugh reveals late effort to keep todd monken away from browns. "i really thought he was coming with us, but cleveland was in there all along," harbaugh shared. Monken was a major driver behind baltimore‚Äôs offensive success in recent seasons.
